subnotes.content:
HAI: Hospital Audiences, Inc. is a non-profit organization created in 1969 to respond to the cultural needs of those people who are institutionalized, disadvantaged, and otherwise culturally isolated.

Produced by Trilogy Films

Directed and photographed by Theo Kamecke; David Bernstein

Filmed at Bird S. Color Memorial Hospital, Roosevelt Island, NYC; Harlem Cultural Center; Green Haven Correctional Facility, Stormville, NY

Film made possible to the Hoffman-LaRoche Foundation and the Grant Foundation. 

Film distribution: 
Rockefeller Foundation

Documentary footage of Hospital Audiences, Inc. volunteers in action, providing support and entertainment for institutionalized people in elderly care facilities, hospitals, cultural centers, and correctional facilities.
Perforations are slightly damaged. Recommendation is to not play this film on a flatbed editor (steenbeck) again.

RAC is unable to provide access to obsolete media and original digital media. In addition separated media may not yet have undergone stabilization procedures.
